titles.title: Vehicular Terrorism Prevention Act of 2017
Vehicular Terrorism Prevention Act of 2017
A bill to require the Secretary of Homeland Security to examine the actions the Department of Homeland Security is undertaking to combat the threat of vehicular terrorism, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

bill.summary:
Vehicular Terrorism Prevention Act of 2017
This bill directs the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to: (1) examine actions DHS is undertaking to combat the threat of vehicular terrorism, and (2) report to Congress.
The report shall outline examinations of:
the current threat level for vehicular terrorism, actions DHS is undertaking to guard against vehicular terrorism, how the threat of vehicular terrorism may be mitigated, the extent to which DHS is doing outreach or training with private sector partners in response to such threat, and actions Congress can take to help DHS mitigate the threat.
